meanings.definition: Relating to or denoting the simultaneous presentation of different stimuli to each ear.
meanings.sent1: The dichotic sounds in the headphones made it hard to focus on one melody.
meanings.sent2: The dichotic nature of the experiment required participants to listen carefully to both sides.
meanings.sent3: The dichotic music playing in the store created a unique atmosphere for shoppers.
meanings.sent4: Her dichotic approach to problem-solving involved considering multiple perspectives at once.
meanings.sent5: The dichotic voices in the play echoed through the theater, captivating the audience.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the perception of different sounds in each ear.
meanings.sent1: The dichotic headphones allowed him to hear different beats in each ear.
meanings.sent2: The dichotic experience of hearing birds chirping on one side and a car honking on the other was disorienting.
meanings.sent3: The dichotic whispers in the movie theater made the scene even more suspenseful.
meanings.sent4: Her dichotic hearing made it challenging to locate where each sound was coming from.
meanings.sent5: The dichotic tones of the piano piece created a harmonious yet distinct auditory experience.
